Dear Sheffield City Council,
I am writing to request information under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. I am seeking data on reports and instances of abandoned dogs within your council’s jurisdiction during the period from 1st January 2020 to 31st December 2024.
Specifically, I would like to request the following information:
The total number of abandoned dogs that were reported to your council each month between January 2020 and December 2024.
The total number of abandoned dogs that were taken in, seized, or otherwise handled by your council each month during this period.
If possible, I would appreciate the data being presented as a month-by-month breakdown for each of the years in question (2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, and 2024).
If providing a full month-by-month breakdown would exceed cost or time limits, I would be happy to discuss ways to refine my request. Please let me know how I may adjust it to ensure that it falls within the cost limits of the Act.
If you require any clarification regarding this request, please do not hesitate to get in touch. I am happy to provide any additional details necessary to facilitate the processing of this request.
I would be grateful if you could acknowledge receipt of this request and provide an estimated timeframe for your response.
Thank you for your assistance.
Yours faithfully,
Thomas Rose

Dear Thomas Rose,
Thank you for your request for information relating to abandoned dogs
which we received on 18/12/2024.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 21/01/2025. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
